data.title: Outlook magazine photograph collection
data.meta_description: Archives West provides access to descriptions of primary sources in the western United States, including correspondence, diaries, and photographs. Digital reproductions of primary sources are available in some cases. Archives West was formerly known as the Northwest Digital Archives (NWDA).
data.text:
Box 3

5:01:01-09: Graduate School. Images of students, teachers, and administrators of the graduate school. Those identified include Gwen Haws, group of pre-med students who were accepted to medical school, and graduate student Tom White

3

5:02:01-04: Landscape Architecture. Images of playground being built by the department of landscape architecture in

3

5:03:01-16: Languages. Students at the various language fairs held at Utah State University. Images of students and teachers (summer institute) using the language lab. Identified images include Jerry Benbow on the coast of Spain, Dianne McCann receiving superior ratings from Dr. Alfred N. Smith and Mrs. Klara Ingold, Annette Cowley using developmental reading machine, Lonnie Kay working with language equipment, and Sarah Cooper in language lab

3

5:04:01-62: Music. Staff members and Professors identified include Naunie Gardner, Warren Burton, Jester Hairston, William Ramsey Willard R. Kesling, Jr., G.H. Pro, and Irving Wasserman. Images include outdoor performances and indoor performances of band, symphonic band, orchestra, and choir. Group photograph of the Sunburst Singers along with a photo of them performing in Thailand. Images of USU Chorale and their director. Photos of soloists for different performances

4

5:05:01-36: Music. Images of performing groups such as Calico Performing Company, Hands Up Troupe, Youngtimers, and USU Student Productions Performing Group. Also images of the Prague Chamber Orchestra and Gabrieli String Quartet. Performance in the Tabernacle by Utah Symphony. Several images of Maurice Abravanel individually and conducting the Utah Symphony Orchestra. Sunburst Singers performing at events such as the Glen Miller Show. Individual photos of musicians

4

5:06:01-17: Music Clinics. Faculty members and conductors of Summer Music Clinic. Group photos of students practicing for clinic concert and faculty participating in Music Clinic faculty recital. Group photo of soloists. Rehearsal for first cello festival in Cache Valley

4

5:07:01-50: Science. Students and professors working in the chemistry, electrodynamics, genetics, and science labs. Students watching an eclipse. Series of photos depicting the presentation of a departmental assistance grant by Gulf Oil Company to USU department of geology. Classroom activities of zoology and geology classes. Individual photos of various people associated with science. Also included are six strips of negatives

4

6:01:01-05: Dairy Science. Images of cows, bulls, and people associated with the dairy herdsman, dairy manager, dairy days, and Dairy Research Center at USU. Those identified in images include Robert C. Lamb, Les Ferreira, Jerry Loscheider, David Escobar, A.J. Morris, and C.A. Ernstrom

4

6:02:01-66: Education Department. Images of people involved with the education department. Includes single photos and photos of teachers, student teachers, and students in and outside of the classroom

4

6:03:01-44: Engineering. Administrators, professors, teachers, and students associated with the college of engineering. Photos of students and others performing experiments and using equipment. Mostly group images

4

6:04:01-11: Engineering. Images of experiments conducted by USU engineering students and staff and an experiment performed by the USU Engineering Experiment Station. Also included are 33 prints of two men and a woman sitting at a table. One of the men is holding an American Concrete Institute Charter for the Intermountain Chapter. Also includes a cartoon drawn on a board about geothermal energy

4

6:05:01-61: Department of Family Life. Predominantly images of fashion design students modeling their designs. Some images of cooking, sewing, other various activities and classes

4

6:06:01-53: Department of Family Life. Predominantly images of cooking classes. Also some images of sewing classes, fashion design students modeling their own designs, and teachers and students in and outside of the classroom. Images of high school students participating in events sponsored by the university

4

6:07:01-36: Department of Family Life. Cooking classes and table settings. Also fashion design students modeling their designs

4

6:08:01-54: Department of Fine Arts. Images of wall hangings, pictures, and sculptures designed and made by those in the fine arts department. Also images of people walking through an art museum. Snapshots of classroom settings and meetings

4

6:09:01-55: Department of Fine Arts. Images of art and art exhibits, mostly of Asian and Native American art. Several snapshots of two children, Li Kang and Li Jen

Also included are negatives from Watercolor West in 1972.

5

6:10:01-13: Department of Fine Arts. Images of paintings by various artists. Image of classrooms and various areas inside the Chase Fine Arts Center and Kent Concert Hall

5

6:11:01-35: Images of various activities with special needs, hearing impaired, and autistic students and individuals. Includes skiing activity at Beaver Mountain Ski Resort and also work and classroom scenes

5

6:12:01-14: Humanities and Arts. Individual and group images of students, teachers, and others involved in the humanities and arts program

5

7:01:01-20: Military Science. Utah State University students participating in the ROTC. Snapshots of cadets and others participating in various meetings and award ceremonies on campus

5

7:02:01-26: Military Science. Snapshots of cadets and officers participating in military science activities and the U.S. Army on the campus of Utah State University

5

7:03:01-33: Department of Natural Resources. Snapshots of students, administrators, and professors at various meetings and functions. Some images of them on field trips and doing field research

5

7:04:01-31: Department of Natural Resources. Snapshots of people performing experiments with a trees, mainly outdoor winter scenes. Also images of various animals, namely rhinoceros, rabbits, deer, and birds

5

7:05:01-14: Department of Natural Resources. Snapshots of students and professors participating in meetings and activities. Also images of students and professors working with ducks, birds, and baby coyotes

5

7:06:01-02: Plant Science. Photograph of the old Plant Industry Building and also an image of a plant science class in 1888

5

7:07:01-04: Soils and Meteorology. Photographs of an ultra-high vacuum system, soil testing equipment used by the USU soil testing services, and a ventilated thermocouple shield

5

7:08:01-03: Photographs of a man preparing food for the animals and a professor and students looking at preserved specimen for veterinary pathology

5

8:01:01-03: Old Main-exterior. Images of a weather vane on top of one of the towers on Old Main and campus scenes from the

5

8:02:01-25: Old Main-exterior. Images of Old Main from different views during different seasons of the year

5

8:03:01-08: Old Main-exterior. Images of Old Main from different views during different seasons of the year

5

8:04:01-37: Opening of the cornerstone on

Images of the ceremony to unseal and reseal the cornerstone. Noted individuals in photos include Governor Norman Bangerter and Stanford Cazier.

5

8:05:01-32: Opening of the cornerstone on

Mainly images of the artifacts contained inside the cornerstone and people looking at the displays. Included in the photographs are A.J. Simmonds, Max Peterson, George Ellsworth, Michael Johnson.

5

8:06:01-12: Ground breaking ceremonies. Ground breaking of several buildings including the Nutrition and Food Sciences Building in

5

9:01:01-06: Logan Institute of Religion and L.D.S. Stake Center. Individual portraits of two men, as well as, images of the Logan Institute and the "Golden Toaster" Stake Center of the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints

5

9:02:01-13: Agriculture. Images from a farm including photos of cows, horses, and chicks. Photo of cows grazing on created wheatgrass for the NoAgua Re-seeding Project

Some negatives also included.

5

9:03:01-12: Agriculture. Various photos of men on the farm. Also included are images of a man holding cheese, awards, bees, cheese fish bait, and a type of grain called quinoa

5

9:04:01-10: Agriculture. Various photos of men working on the farm. Also included are images of people with awards, display of cheese fish bait, and flower arranging

5

9:05:01-11: Agriculture. Images of men working with sheep and shearing sheep, meat packing plant, men working on the farm, meetings, and awards

5

9:06:01-04: Agricultural Science. Different view of the Agricultural Science Building

5

9:07:01: Agricultural Systems Technology and Education Building

5

9:08:01-04: Amphitheater

5

9:09:01-02: Animal Industry Building

5

9:10:01: Animal Nutrition Research Laboratory

5

9:11:01: Art Barn

5

9:12:01-02: Nora Eccles Harrison Art Museum. Images of museum during construction and a photo of the exterior

5

9:13:01: Jay Dee Harrises Athletic Center

5

9:14:01-07: Biology and Natural Resources Building

5

9:15:01: Bookstore

6

9:16:01-04: George S. Eccles Business Building. Images from the construction and dedication, as well as exterior photos

6

9:17:01-13: Campus views, mainly aerials

6

9:18:01-02: Center for Persons with Disabilities

Also includes one negative.

6

9:19:01-05: Chemistry and Biochemistry Lab. One image of Glen Lawrence working in the lab of the Department of Chemistry and Biochemistry

6

9:20:01-13: College Bluebird

Images of the exterior and interior of the College Bluebird with and without customers inside. George McDermaid carrying a large container in several photographs.

6

9:21:01: Computer Center

6

9:22:01-04: Crops Research Laboratory. Images of building during construction and images of the completed building

6

9:23:01-09: Dorms and Residence Halls

6

9:24:01-13: Eccles Conference Center. Interior and exterior images of the conference center

6

9:25:01-04: Edith Bowen Laboratory School

6

9:26:01: Emma Eccles Jones Education Building

6

9:27:01-09: Engineering. Images of the Dean F. Peterson Engineering Building during construction and after, as well as images of the old Engineering Building

6

9:28:01: George Nelson Fieldhouse, interior

6

9:29:11: Fine Arts Center. Images of construction of building and the exterior. Also images of organ and Kent Concert Hall during a performance

6

9:30:01-03: Greenhouse. Century plant growing through a hole in the roof

6

9:31:01-05: Health, Physical Education, and Recreation building. Images during construction and of the exterior and interior of the finished building

6

9:32:01-03: Heating Plant. Drawing and photo of Heating plant

Also contains one negative.

6

10:01:01-34: Campus Scenes. Images taken at various locations around campus. Photos of the different buildings and gathering locations of students on university grounds. Also some photos of the student housing facilities

6

10:02:01-17: Campus Scenes. Images taken at various locations around campus. Photos are mainly of students at various areas around campus, also photos of the landscaping

6

10:03:01-08: Cement "Year" Stones. Images of class year numbers in the cement at various locations around campus

6

10:04:01-45: Construction Projects. Images of buildings being constructed around campus. Also included are preliminary drawings and sketches of proposed buildings for the campus

6

10:05:01-33: Library. Images of the interior and exterior of the Milton R. Merrill Library. Mostly photos of students inside of the library studying and librarians helping students find requested items

6

10:06:01-12: Tree Removal. Photographs of crews taking out trees at various locations across campus. Also included are photos of uprooted trees from the windstorm on

6

10:07:01-18: Stadium. Images of the volunteer labor days for the expansion of Romney Stadium. Volunteer laborers include the USU Administration, Army ROTC, and Amundson Construction. Also includes images of October 1971 football game. Mainly photos of crowd and press booth

6

10:08:01: Technical Services

6

11:01:01-51: Children: Nursery and Edith Bowen. Predominantly images of children in the classroom at school or on the playground with their teachers, student teachers, and other students. Some photos of a group of young girls in a ballet class

6

11:02:01-51: Children: Nursery and Edith Bowen. Images of the faculty in meetings and gatherings. Children in the classroom using different kinds of learning equipment, some are being helped by teachers and student teachers. Photos of a typewriting class

6

11:03:01-19: Children: Nursery and Edith Bowen. Children, in the classroom and out, being assisted and led by the teacher. Photos of Edith Bowen School taken from various locations around the school

6

11:04:01-24: Fine Arts Center. Interior and exterior views of the Fine Arts Center. Scenes from the opera Susanna, and also images of others who were to perform in the center. Photos of the crowd waiting for a performance to begin

Several negatives also included.

6

11:05:01-07: Home Economics. Various exterior images of the Home Economics Building

6

11:06:01: Industrial Science. Exterior view of the Industrial Science Building

7

11:07:01-02: Institute. Exterior views of the Logan Institute of Religion

7

11:08:01-08: Library-Milton R. Merrill. Interior and exterior views of the Merrill Library. Also included are a few images of the old library and construction of the Milton R. Merrill Library

7

11:09:01-32: Library-Milton R. Merrill-Special Collections & Archives. Images of workers and archivists A.J. Simmonds and Peter Schmid. Includes images of the Tanner Reading Room, the Hatch Room, and people looking at different items included in the collection. Includes photos of document conservation and book restoration techniques used in the collection

7

11:10:01-04: Library-Science and Technology. Photos of the crane tower during the construction of the Sci-Tech Library. Also an aerial image of the foundation and basement

7

11:11:01: Life Span Learning Center, located in the Eccles Conference Center

7

11:12:01-15: Mechanic Arts Building. Exterior views of the Mechanic Arts Building, and also photos taken during the demolition of the building

7

11:13:01-04: Miscellaneous Campus Buildings

7

11:14:01: Natural Resources. Exterior view of the Natural Resources Building

7

11:15:01-03: Nutrition and Food Sciences. Exterior views of the Nutrition and Food Sciences Building

7

11:16:01-24: Old Main-Construction and Renovation. Mainly images of the construction and renovation of the auditorium and towers of Old Main. Several color images after the construction was completed are included

7

11:17:01-03: Old Main-Fire. Images of Old Main during and after the fire on

7

11:18:01-03: Old Main. Interior views of Old Main including classrooms and hallway

7

11:19:01-02: Parking Terrace. Images of terrace during its construction and after its completion

7

11:20:01-17: Plant Industry. Images of several different greenhouses and buildings around campus that have been landscaped with various plants

7

11:21:01-03: President's House. Exterior views taken from different locations around the house

One color image included.

7

11:22:01-04: Quad. Views of the Quad from several different locations, one color image. Also some prints of Old Main Hill

7

11:23:01-03: Smart (Thomas) Gymnasium. Two exterior images taken from the front of the building and one image of the gym as it was being demolished

7

11:24:01: St. John's Episcopal Church

7

11:25:01: St. Thomas Aquinas Catholic Church and Newman Center

7

11:26:01-02: Sculptures. Two images of sculptures on campus. Identified sculpture, "Sojourn" by James Russell

7

11:27:01: Snow Carnival. Snow sculpture of a train on the Quad made during the Snow Carnival

7

11:28:01-02: Space Dynamics Laboratory. Two images of the Jake Garn Space Research Building

7

11:29:01-04: Spectrum. Images of interior and exterior of the Spectrum during the construction and after its completion

7

11:30:01-03: Stadium. Aerial drawing of the stadium and one photo taken from the south end of the stadium

7

11:31:01-02: Stores and Storage. Images of the dock area of the Stores-Receiving Building. USU President Daryl Chase and Leslie Downs shown in photos

7

11:32:01-08: Student Center. Images of Taggart Student Center during construction and renovation. Exterior images of completed student center from several different locations

7

11:33:01-06: Student Housing. Photos of Aggie Village under construction, groundbreaking of the David O. McKay Housing Center, Anthon H. Lund Hall under construction, and the Women's Dormitory

7

11:34:01-07: Tanner Fountain. Images of the Obert C. Tanner Fountain taken from several different locations

One color image included.

7

11:35:01-15: University Inn. Aerial and ground level images during construction. Also images of the reflective exterior and the inside layout of the rooms

7

11:36:01-10: Utah Water Research Laboratory. Interior and exterior views of the lab. Photos of several different doctors working in the lab

7

11:37:01-02: Widtsoe Hall. Two different views of the exterior of Widtsoe Hall

7

11:38:01: Women's Center Dedication. Betty Ford, Dean Helen Lundstrom, and Gerald Ford at the dedication of the Women's Center in

7

12:01:01-43: President Stanford Cazier. Predominately images from President Cazier's inauguration in January 1979. Also included are snapshots of Cazier and his wife, Shirley, at various functions throughout his term as president

7

12:02:01-11: President Stanford Cazier. Images (8x10) of Stanford Cazier, some portraits and some of President Cazier with other individuals , some of which include his wife, Shirley; Miss Utah Teen, Deborah Dutson; and the head coach, Charlie Weatherbie

Also included are eight strips of negatives.

7

12:03:01-28: President George Emert. Images of President Emert taken while in what is presumed to be an interview. Also photos of him and his wife speaking at some type of press conference. Images of inauguration activities, and also included are the inauguration announcement and schedule of activities for the day of inauguration

7

12:04:01-58: President Glen Taggart. Images of President Taggart at various functions while he served his term as president of the university. Some images include Taggart at graduation exercises, playing racquetball, and interacting with different groups of people at several different functions

7

12:05:01-12: President Glen Taggart. Images of President Taggart interacting with different groups of people. Some images of his inauguration exercises and also photos of him in what is presumed to be an interview

7

12:06:01-38: President Daryl Chase. President Chase interacting with different groups of people during his term as president of the university

8

12:07:01-34: President Daryl Chase. Portraits of President Chase and also several different color transparencies that were made in 1961. Photos of Chase and others at a banquet and also photos of Chase with President David O. Mckay (President of the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints) and others participating in graduation exercises

8

12:08:01-20: Deans. Portraits and casual photographs of the deans of the colleges that are part of the university

8

12:09:01-13: Board of Trustees. Images of a meeting of the board of trustees. Also included are individual portraits and group snapshots of different members of the board

8

13:49:01: Golden Aggies Reunion

14:01:01-07: Admissions and Records. Images of students participating in the registration process, also images of people working in the office. One image of a woman assisting a boy in the bookstore. Identified individuals include Mark Neuberger and Rebecca Peterson

8

14:02:01-09: Aerospace Studies. Color images of USU students watching the launch of a space shuttle. Other images include a photo of a U.S. Air Force airplane, Mark Craft examining a temporary landing field, two women holding up a sign, and a man standing in between two women cadets giving one of them flowers. Portraits of Capt. Roscoe H Burgoyne and Col. Ralph F. Jackson. Color image from the John F. Kennedy Space Center of the launch of the Space Shuttle Discovery

8

14:02:01-19: Aerospace Studies. Images of groups of cadets in class and outside of class. Also images of cadets receiving various awards, and cadets at the Valley Airmotive Corp. Those individuals identified in photos include J.C. Mortensen, Dennis Allen, Timothy M. Anderson, Russell Glenn, and Pam Daines

8

14:03:01: Agricultural Experiment Station. Workers Sue Truxes and Joan Shaw on an experiment station test site

8

14:04:01-10: Art. Images of students working on the final project for a ceramics course taught by Nicholas Bonner, also images of finished final project. Photos of USU artists at work, those identified include Adrian Van Suchtelen, and Gary Head

8

14:05:01-11: Art. Photos of paintings, sculptures, posters, and pottery created by USU students Also a photo of a student working on an outdoor monumental sculpture and a group of students receiving an award. Identified artists include Bruce Borg, Court Naumanb, Ruth Frericks, "Taro" Seesurat, William Wensley, and Katarina Weslien

8

14:06:01-10: Art. Photos of art included in exhibitions on the USU campus including Second Watercolor West, IBM Collection of American Drawings and Water Colors, Dan Strom: Photo Silkscreen Prints, and Utah Painting '70. Images of artists working on their pottery and sculpting projects and also images of two different artists standing by their wall hangings

8

14:07:01-10: Art. Image of a man working on a pot. Photos of different pieces of art including a wall hanging, photography projects, and a ceramic sculpture. Images of students in an art class and a photo of Thumrongluck Seesurat standing next to her finished sculpture

8

14:08:01-10: Art. Photos of paintings and other pieces of art. Identified artists include Barse Miller, Katherine Page Porter, Paul M. Souza, Gerald F. Brommer. Images of professional illustrator Richard Heubner demonstrating for students, Robert Piepenberg looking over students work during a workshop on raku pottery, and Doris Baugh restoring a rocking chair

8

14:09:01-09: Art. Photos of pieces of art including paintings, wall hangings, and pottery. Photos of instructors looking over their student's work

8

14:10:01-09: Art. Photos of pieces of art, some with the artists working on them. Art pieces include paintings, drawings, pottery, and wall hangings. Also an image of some students handing up a poster announcing the Fine Arts Tour to San Francisco

8

14:11:01-09: Art. Photos of people looking at art and artists with their artwork. One photo of a person making a sculpture

8

14:12:01-10: Art. Photos of pieces of art including paintings, wall hangings, and pottery. One image of an art class. Identified artists include Judith Smith, Don Curtis, Kent Jeppesen, R. Bishop, and Jay Smith

8

14:13:01-08: Art. Photos of pieces of art on display, some images with people looking at the displayed art. Identified artists include Dan Strom, Tetsuo Kusama, and Ron Bishop

8

14:14:01-10: Art. Photos of pieces of art including paintings, sculptures, and a floor piece. Images from inside an art gallery. Photos of students in and outside of the classroom. Identified artists include Tetsuo Kusama, Adrian Van Suchtelen, Ev. Thorpe, Don Wellings and Keith Thomas

8

14:15:01-09: Art. Photos of sculptures, paintings, pottery and the USU pottery sale. Also images of artists working on their pieces of art. Identified artists include Ev. Thorpe, Taro Seesurat, Mike Torchio, Alan Bennet, and Yoshiro Ikela

8

14:16:01-07: Art Department. Photos of people working in the art department and the Hobby Center

8

14:17:01-15: Associated Students of Utah State University. Photos of the officers and different activities conducted by ASUSU. Identified officers include Paul Watterson, Sue Phelpe, Kevin Anderson, and Chris Eyre

8

14:18:01-12: Audiology-Speech Pathology. Images of people employed in and studying the field of audiology and speech pathology during the administration of tests using specialized equipment and while communicating with colleagues

8

14:19:01-12: Audiology-Speech Pathology. Images of a USU professor showing graduate students and others a large model of the human ear used when studying hearing difficulties

8

14:20:01-06: Audiology-Speech Pathology. Sheets of photo prints. Images of audiology testing and a professor pointing out different areas on an oversized ear to students and other individuals

8

14:21:01: Auto Mechanics. Image of the old auto mechanics building

9

14:22:01-15: Business Advisory Committee. Individual portraits of members of the Business Advisory Committee

9

14:23:01-22: Business and Social Studies. Negatives, portraits, and snapshots of individuals associated with the business and social studies programs including students, professors, and teaching assistants

9

14:24:01-05: Crops Research-AG. Images of the Crop Research Lab and crops that are being researched in a greenhouse and in an outdoor garden

9

15:01:01: Institutes. Images of different institutes that were held at USU including the National Videodisc/Microcomputer Institute and NSF Summer Institute. Identified individuals include Gordon Porter, Robert Thompson, Warren Bickel, and Dean Peterson

9

15:02:01-04: Extensions 4-H. Images of a 4-H camping trip with Art Jones as the leader and another activity

9

15:03:01-12: Latin American Affairs. Portraits of the B. Austin Haws family, Nyle J. Matthews family, and two unidentified families. Images of the Bolivian Elementary supervisors and a group performing Hispanic folk music in front of the Utah Arts Council Folk Art Museum

9

15:04:01-25: Native Americans. Predominately images of activities taken of those participating in the Many Eagles American Indian Week (May 1971) and other group activities. Individual portraits of Linda Ridley, Ute; Elsie Benally, Navaho; Regina Tsosie, Navaho; and Patty Timbimboo. Images of USU extension services vaccinating animals. Images of Bill Coffer, director of Indian program, in a field with a bird

9

15:05:01-24: Extension Services. Images of the USU extension in Bolivia, 4-H activites, the extension poultryman and economist, demonstrations on putting shoes on a horse, and other extension services and personnel

9

16:01:01-07: Dancers at USU. Images of Claude Kipnis performing in the Claude Kipnis Mime Theatre and a performance of Frula on their second North American tour

9

16:02:01-42: International. Images of international week, international programs, and international students. Includes several negatives taken in Mexico during the

9

16:03:01-30: Musical Visitors at USU. Images of musical performers who entertained at USU

9

16:04:01-31: Visitors at USU. Images of notable individuals who have visited USU. Includes portraits and also snapshots of the individual while performing or speaking in front of USU audience. Large proportion of snapshots depict the visit of John Denver

9

16:05:01-30: Visitors at USU. Images of notable individuals who have visited USU. Includes portraits and also snapshots of the individual while speaking to USU audience

9

16:06:01-36: Speakers at USU. Images of noted writers, scholars, actors, actresses, and others addressing students and faculty. Also includes some portraits of the noted individuals
